intro: Antidesma pacificum, commonly known as the Pacific antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by colorful bracts. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
